definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: Make sure to stir up all the sedimentation on the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 保证引起在底部的所有沉积作用。

sentences.english: The mechanism of sedimentation includes flood type and slump type.
sentences.chinese: 重力流沉积作用的机制包括洪水类型和滑塌类型。

sentences.english: The U-shape of some glacial valleys may be due also to deposition.
sentences.chinese: 某些U型冰川谷也可能起因于沉积作用。

sentences.english: The reservoir is closely controlled by sedimentation and diagenesis.
sentences.chinese: 储层主要受沉积作用和成岩作用的影响。

sentences.english: Toplap is evidence of a non de-positional hiatus .
sentences.chinese: 顶部超覆是无沉积作用间断的证据。

definition: lithosphere (in geology, the rigid crust of the earth)
